title: For Sale:  Sig Sauer P224
location: New Prague, MN, Minnesota, Minnesota, United States
postcontent:
Despite its small size, the P224® maintains a double-stack magazine for a capacity of 12 rounds of 9mm
and 10 rounds of .40S&W or .357SIG giving the P224 a decided advantage over most subcompact
competitors. Newer model P229 magazines can also be used for an even greater round count.

Featuring a lightweight alloy frame, the P224 will be available in a number of configurations. Initial models
will be available with the Double-Action Kellerman™ (DAK) trigger and be chambered in .40S&W. and
.357SIG Traditional DA/SA triggers, and 9mm options will be available in the future.

Full-size SIGLITE® Night Sights allow the P224 to deliver pinpoint accuracy, which can be a challenge in
most subcompacts.

New P224™ Subcompact a Classic SIG SAUER®, with One Small Change An ideal concealed carry or back-up gun, the P224 is an especially good choice for those familiar with the SIG SAUER manual of arms. From the full-sized P226® to the P229 to the P224, the controls and operation all remain the same.

The P224 accepts newer P229 magazines, allowing users to carry a full-size spare magazine as a backup to the flush-fit P224 magazine. Law enforcement officers will appreciate not having to carry separate magazines solely for their backup guns.

As part of the Extreme family of handguns, the P224 will feature the distinctive black and grey Hogue Piranha grips, SIGLITE Night Sights and the SRT (in the DA/SA version).  Include 6 magazines an extra spring and boar bag.

title: For Sale:  FOR SALE: SMITH WESSON M&P 15 SPORT AR 15! GET YOUR HANDS ON IT!
postcontent:
Admit it. It's time to get an AR 15. Either you need your first one, or another one, or one for your brother, or your girlfriend. 

Get the M&P 15 Sport. The holy grail of budget ARs. Skip the cheap carbon fiber crap. Or the other no name cheapos. Research the 15 sport for about 10 minutes I challenge you to find a single negative review of it. Standard A2 front sight, picatinny rail has enough room for a red dot and magnifier if you use the right mounts.

This one is about 4 months old and has 400 rounds through it. Not a single jam or malfunction and that's with budget ammo. Has been cleaned religiously. Dead balls accurate. 

And you can pick and choose your accessories. I can leave it with all the extras and sell it for $675, and then add the pictured ammo as much or as little as you need for $5 a box (total of 480 rounds). Total cost for everything is $800

Or I can strip all the upgrades off and it's yours for $550. It came with one P-mag and the magpul flip up rear sight.

Here's a list of upgrades/extras:

Magpul Slimline forend $40 with MOE Picatinny rail 4" $10
Authentic FAB defense PTK pointer angled foregrip $30
2 30 round promags $10 each
1 metal 10 round mag (great for sighting in off a lead sled) $10 
LULA speed loader $25

Call or text or email REDACTED
Don't lowball me bro. It's worth every penny.
No trades
I travel for work and get around willing to meet halfway and drive about 50 miles if the deal is right
Thanks for lookin

Factory new items are sold as is.  The warranty is to be handled through the original manufacturer.  We will accept returns with prior notice only.  Notice is to be made within a 3 day inspection period from which the merchandise was received. We will issue a 100% refund if we made a mistake in our listing. There will be a 25% restocking fee on all returned items.  Merchandise must still be sealed and as new.  All used merchandise must be in the same shape it left our store in.  Condition will be evaluated when it is received back.  There are no refunds on listings stated "AS IS" in the description. We will not refund any shipping cost or auction fees. All parts should be fitted by qualified personnel. Please email or call if you have any questions before purchasing. 
Other:
Our contact information is available at our website. You can also ask a question via Ebay, Gunbroker, or the website in which you found our listing on. The winning bidder needs to have paid or made contact with us within 3 business days after the auction ending. We are open to trades and offers.
As these items are for sale in multiple venues, we reserve the right to cancel the sale at any time.  On rare occasion we may sell out of an item before we are able to remove it from out listing.  In such an instance we will do our best to either provide the buyer with an equivalent product, discount another product, cancel the sale, or issue a full refund if payment has already been made.  We do our best to avoid these situations, but we are all human and it happens.  Thank you for understanding.
Like us on Facebook at Bama Pawn & Gun !!  Check out our awesome website!!!

title: For Sale:  NEW Custom Built AR-15: BCM Midlength Upper, MEGA Lower, Magpul Furniture, Daniel Defense Parts
postcontent:
Brand new.

Built this up with the goal of running it in carbine courses and having a solid home defense gun, but decided to sink all my money into my mini-14 (I know, I know...). 

Ships with regular pistol grip and bullet button installed.  Includes hammerhead grip and regular magazine release.

Total weight as assembled: 6lbs, 4.2 oz


Upper Receiver: BCM (Bravo Company)
Barrel: BCM Hammer Forged 14.5" midlength light weight profile
Muzzle Device: Parallax Gen 2 Paracomp Muzzle Brake, permanently attached
Handguard: Magpul MOE
Bolt Carrier: BCM
Charging Handle: BCM Gunfighter, Mod 4 (medium latch)
Lower: Mega Gator Forged, 7075-T6 
Parts Kit: Daniel Defense 
Buffer: BCM milspec tube, spring and H-buffer
Stock: Magpul MOE Carbine

The goal with this build was to have a rock solid reliable carbine that could be run with a bullet button OR featureless. This started with BCM's amazing midlength upper assembly (google the "Filthy 14" 40,000 round torture test), with a Parallax Paracomp muzzle brake permanently attached (by the armorers at Wild Built Tactical in La Mesa) to bring barrel to 16". Mega Gator lower receiver with a top-of-the-line Daniel Defense parts kit, and BCM buffer assembly. Magpul MOE handguards and carbine stock.

The Paracomp muzzle brake was chosen because it is not only an excellent muzzle device, but because it is designed as a brake, not a flash hider. That means this rifle can be easily transitioned to a featureless build, and even includes a hammerhead grip and regular magazine release. The Magpul MOE carbine stock was also chosen specifically for this purpose, as you can remove the latch mechanism but still operate the telescoping stock with a tool, rather than having to permanently pin it in a fixed location.

title: For Sale:  Glenfield 30-30 (Marlin)
location: Phenix City, columbus GA, Phenix City, Alabama
postcontent:
I'm asking $335 for the gun, $20 for the soft case. Will come with some ammo. Call REDACTED price is OBO

Make: Marlin Glenfield

Model: Model 30A 

Serial Number: 20055155

Year of Manufacture: 1973 - 1983 

Caliber: .30-30 Ackley Improved. 

Action Type: Lever Action Rifle, Magazine Tube Fed 

Markings: The left side of the barrel is marked “GLENFIELD MOD. 30A”, “THE MARLIN FIREARMS CO. / NORTH HAVEN, CONN., U.S.A.”, “CAL. 30 – 30 WIN”

Barrel Length: 20” 

Sights / Optics: Nearly new Bushnell scope (Bore Sighted)

Stock Configuration & Condition: The stocks are walnut stained birch with impressed designs and checkering on the pistol grip and forearm. The butt stock has a shallow cut about ½” long on the front right side of the comb. There is a brown Pachmayr buttpad and also a sling swivel. The forearm cap has been fitted with a sling swivel. The LOP measures 14” from the front of the trigger to the rear of the recoil pad. The stocks rate in about Fine overall condition. 

Type of Finish: Blue 

Finish Originality: Original

Bore Condition: The bore is bright and the Micro-Groove rifling is sharp. There is no erosion and the barrel crown is unmarked. 

Overall Condition: This rifle retains about 90% of its metal finish. The balance of the finish shows thinning, brown patina and some bare metal where the bluing has worn through. The area around the rear sight dovetail shows some tool marks. Please see the photos. The markings are clear. Overall, this rifle rates in about Very Good condition. 

Mechanics: The action functions correctly. I have fired this weapon 

Box, Paperwork & Accessories: Bushnell Scope 71-3946C waterproof 3x-9x40 scope 

Our Assessment: The Marlin Glenfield line of rifles were made to the same standards as the standard Marlin rifles with the exception of wood, and cosmetic appearance. This rifle has a half magazine and impressed decorations and checkering. It is marked on the barrel as a Model 30A, although in Brophy’s book on the history of Marlin, he states that the Model 30 became the 30A when the half magazine was replaced by a full magazine. Perhaps this is a rare transition model or special factory order. In any event, it is a classic deer rifle that you wouldn’t be afraid to carry in the field and is already equipped with sights that are adequate to the range of the cartridge.

Looking for cash, but WILL trade for a matching Nazi-marked Star 9mm. Old stuff gets my attention, so if you want to trade, that's the area! 

EMAIL FOR PICS!  I have plenty, and can only upload several.

An Argentine improvement on the venerable 1911, Argentina produced the Ballester-Molina from the late 30s to the early 50s. I bought this specifically because it dates to 1945, and was a part of my World War collection. 

The Ballester Molina often gets called a 1911 Copy, but it's not internally. The mags, spring, and barrel are all interchangeable however, so there IS some custom options available if that's your bag. Unlike a 1911 or many strict copies, this doesn't bite a bit: the beavertail does its job admirably, you'll like shooting this pistol! It's all original too (except the mag, but you can find old BM or old 1911 mags easily, they fit), it just came to me with the black mag. I don't buy anything for myself that's been refinished/replaced or 'bubba'ed. 

DESCRIPTION
Blueing - Worn. All writing is legible, and the assignment mark (Buenos Aires Capital Police) is crisp and very visible. It clearly shows holster wear, as the blueing is pretty much at <15%, and IS import-marked under the spring housing. 

Grips - 8.5/10 Great shape original Argentinian grips and screws. No aftermarket nonsense. 

Barrel - 8/10 Very accurate, and less 'defined' grooves are indeed typical of BM barrels. Don't worry, she'll hit what you aim at! No rusting, cleans to a mirror. I am not the best or most dedicated bore-photographer, so the photo is as photo does. 

Internals - Everything works. Shot it many times, trigger is pretty nice. All machining is crisp, not too much internal wear. Outside is definitely rougher than the inside!

Open to shipping or face to face, as long as buyer communicative. Also available to meet in DC/MD/VA area, as I frequently travel there for business. There are no returns, I have had bad experience with broken returned pieces. Will answer any and all questions though! It is relisted in the DMV area FYI, so that is *with* my knowledge/intent. 

Thanks for looking!

title: For Sale/Trade:   1945 matching Ballester Molina pistol; Capital Police; GREAT SHOOTER
location: DMV area, NoVA, MD to Bmore, Northern Virginia, Virginia
postcontent:
For sale is my 1945 Ballester Molina. An excellent shooter or case-collectible, this gun is an interesting piece of interwar design and essential to any military or 1911 collection. I was recently gifted a piece with some definite background, so I'm selling my duplicate Ballester.
Looking for cash, but WILL trade for a matching Nazi-marked Star 9mm. Old stuff gets my attention, so if you want to trade, that's the area! $550 is starting offer otherwise.

EMAIL FOR PICS! I have plenty, and can only upload several.

An Argentine improvement on the venerable 1911, Argentina produced the Ballester-Molina from the late 30s to the early 50s. I bought this specifically because it dates to 1945, and was a part of my World War collection.

The Ballester Molina often gets called a 1911 Copy, but it's not internally. The mags, spring, and barrel are all interchangeable however, so there IS some custom options available if that's your bag. Unlike a 1911 or many strict copies, this doesn't bite a bit: the beavertail does its job admirably, you'll like shooting this pistol! It's all original too (except the mag, but you can find old BM or old 1911 mags easily, they fit), it just came to me with the black mag. I don't buy anything for myself that's been refinished/replaced or 'bubba'ed.

DESCRIPTION
Blueing - Worn. All writing is legible, and the assignment mark (Buenos Aires Capital Police) is crisp and very visible. It clearly shows holster wear, as the blueing is pretty much at <15%, and IS import-marked under the spring housing.

Grips - 8.5/10 Great shape original Argentinian grips and screws. No aftermarket nonsense.

Barrel - 8/10 Very accurate, and less 'defined' grooves are indeed typical of BM barrels. Don't worry, she'll hit what you aim at! No rusting, cleans to a mirror. I am not the best or most dedicated bore-photographer, so the photo is as photo does.

Internals - Everything works. Shot it many times, trigger is pretty nice. All machining is crisp, not too much internal wear. Outside is definitely rougher than the inside!

Open to shipping or face to face, as long as buyer communicative. Also available to meet in certain parts of Connecticut, as I frequently travel there. There are no returns, I have had bad experience with broken returned pieces. Will answer any and all questions though! It is relisted in Connecticut  FYI, so that is *with* my knowledge/intent.

Thanks for looking!

title: For Sale:  CVA Hawken Muzzleloader .50 caliber percussion cap - TONS of accessories
postcontent:
This is a good condition CVA Hawken muzzleloader.  I have used this for hunting this past year but am transitioning to straight walled cartridges now so I have no need for this rifle.  I also have a number of accessories since I will not longer need blackpowder/muzzleloading devices anymore.  It is side lock, .50 caliber and and uses percussion caps but you can also find 209 primer conversion kits (I don't have one).  

Accessories include - triple seven ffp powder, hornady .495 round ball (90 balls left), three tubes for holding spare loads, bore butter, 209 primers for a 209 conversion, a very quality brass powder measure, a nice brass muzzleloading starter, thin cotton cloth for stuffing, and compressed air cartridges for any stuck loads, and a can of about 90 percussion caps.  

This would be a fantastic purchase for anyone looking to get into muzzleloading.  I have truly everything you need and this is a very affordable rifle that is still capable of taking a deer for sure.

title: For Sale:  Rossi R92-55001 .44 Mag Lever-Action Rifle with 20″ Blued Round Barrel
postcontent:
We have hundreds of other guns currently IN STOCK, and offer some of Utah’s lowest prices! For a complete listing of my current inventory, and to purchase this and other guns online, please be sure to VISIT US ON THE WEB AT:   ***** TooeleShootingSupply.com *****  
The Rossi tradition of firearm design and manufacturing started with the founding of the company in 1889 by Amadeo Rossi. Over the last 115 years, that tradition has grown along with the company. Over the years, Rossi firearms has led the way in design and engineering. At the same time, it has always been important to produce an affordable product without sacrificing quality or accuracy. In 2008, Rossi was acquired by Taurus and together the two firms work to improve products and create new lines.
The Winchester Model 1892 was a lever action repeating rifle designed by John Browning as a smaller, lighter version of his large-frame Model 1886– which replaced the Model 1873 as the company’s lever-action for smaller dual-purpose rounds such as the 44-40. Cowboys on the frontier found it convenient to carry a rifle and a revolver chambered with the same ammunition. When asked by Winchester to design an improved pistol caliber lever action, John Browning said he would have the prototype completed in under a month– or it would be free. Two weeks later, Browning had a functioning prototype of the Model 92.
The Model 1892 has become an indelible icon of Western mythology through its use in hundreds of motion pictures and television shows. Even though Winchester ended production of the Model 92 in 1938, Rossi continues to manufacture a faithful reproduction of this historic rifle to this day.
